questions.question: An application firewall operates at which layer of the OSI model?
questions.explanation: An application firewall operates at Layer 7 of the OSI model. Don’t confuse this with a network firewall, which operates at layer 3.

questions.question: A network firewall operates at which layer of the OSI model?
questions.explanation: A network firewall operates at Layer 3 of the OSI model. Don’t confuse this with an application firewall, which operates at layer 7.

questions.question: What is a secure alternative to Telnet, and which port does it use?
questions.explanation: SSH (Secure Shell) is the secure version of Telnet, and it uses Port 22 for encrypted terminal sessions.

questions.question: Instead of the insecure HTTP protocol, what secure protocol should be used for secure web communication?
questions.explanation: HTTPS (Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure) is the secure version of HTTP and operates over TLS/SSL, typically using Port 443 for encrypted web communication.
